tooltips.correlation_matrix: Shows feature correlations: values range from -1 (strong negative) to 1 (strong positive). Darker colors indicate stronger relationships.
tooltips.preprocessing_plot: Parallel Coordinates plot visualizes multidimensional data with each vertical axis representing a feature and each line an observation.
tooltips.performance_plot:
Accuracy measures the ratio of correct predictions made by the model against the wrong ones.
Precision (or Specificity) indicates how many of the positive predictions of the model are actually correct.
Recall (or Sensitivity) measures the proportion of positive predictions of the model among all actual positives in the dataset.
ROC AUC -- Area Under ROC (Receiver Operating Characteristic) Curve -- measures the model's ability to distinguish between positive and negative classes.
F1 Score is the harmonic mean of precision and recall.
tooltips.polarization_plot: Polarized data are generated from the original data by exacerbating the bias and are employed to stress test AI model: helping to understand and define the systemâ€™s boundaries in terms of fairness by observing how it performs under extreme and varied conditions.
tooltips.fairness_plot:
Demographic Parity Ratio measures fairness by comparing the proportion of positive predictions across different sensitive groups.
Equalized Odds Ratio measures the model's ability in predicting correct and wrong classes across the sensitive groups.
